intro: Tovomita caloneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined tovomita, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees, and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets and produces small, clustered flowers. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
